thread.title: Morgue holding Kim Jong Nam’s corpse reports break-in | New York Post
thread.title_full: Morgue holding Kim Jong Nam’s corpse reports break-in | New York Post

author: Jamie Schram
title: Morgue holding Kim Jong Nam’s corpse reports break-in | New York Post
text:
Malaysian police said Wednesday that someone tried to break into the morgue where the corpse of Kim Jong Nam is being kept, so they have ramped up security to discourage any other body snatchers.
“We knew there were attempts by someone to break into the hospital mortuary. We had to take precautions. We will not allow anyone to tamper with the mortuary,” Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Khalid Abu Bakar told the Malay Mail on Wednesday. 
A brigade of heavily-armed special forces soldiers has been deployed to the hospital to keep Jong Nam’s body safe, according to the newspaper.
Bakar said police had identified the would-be burglars, but said there was “no need” to reveal who they are.
Jong Nam – the estranged half- brother of North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un – has been kept at the hospital mortuary while doctors try to determine his exact cause of death.
So far, two separate examinations have failed to reveal what killed him, although police believe that he was felled by some type of poison.
Additional post-mortem tests were currently underway.
Jong Nam, 45, was attacked by two women in the crowded departure terminal at Kuala Lumpur International Airport on Feb. 13.
Police said Tuesday that the highly-trained killers had smeared their bare hands with deadly toxins and wiped them on Jong Nam’s face.
The globetrotting playboy suffered a seizure before dying en-route to a local hospital.
The murderers fled in a cab, but were later captured along with several other suspects.
Meanwhile, North Korean diplomats insisted Wednesday that the female killers were “innocent” and should be released immediately, according to Al Jazeera. 
In a statement, the diplomats asked “how is it possible that these female suspects could still be alive” if they had poison on their hands?
In other developments, a North Korean diplomat was wanted for questioning in the case, along with a North Korean airline worker.
